short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: CRO Pulse brings Exatom’s Experience Analytics metrics to your website. Unlocking the metrics that impact your form's performance.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Hey there, marketers, CRO specialists, and developers! 👋

Tired of juggling between tabs to check your form analytics? Say hello to CRO Pulse, the new Chrome extension that brings Exatom’s Experience Analytics metrics straight to your website. Now, for every form and field, you can instantly see the metrics that impact your form's performance. It's like having X-ray vision for your forms! 🕶️

🆓 New to Exatom? 🆓
Start your FREE trial today and turn those Missed Conversion Opportunities into wins!
Sign Up Here 👉 https://olympus.exatom.io/signup

🚀 Key Metrics at Your Fingertips 🚀
- Missed Conversion Opportunity & Dropoff Rate: Uncover which fields are causing users to abandon your form.
- Autofill Rate: See which fields users breeze through and which ones need a tweak.
- Error & Correction Rate: Spot fields that trip up users or lead to frequent corrections.
- Interaction & Hesitation Timings: Identify questions or designs that slow users down.

🤝 Collaborate Seamlessly 🤝
Designed for team synergy, CRO Pulse lets you and your team easily share screenshots of important metrics. Keep everyone in the loop without the hassle!

🎥 Dive into Session Replays 🎥
Jump straight into Exatom Session Replays and watch user interactions with our unique, time-saving Friction Score.

🌟 Enjoying CRO Pulse? Let us know! Rate us ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ and leave a review. Your feedback fuels our improvements and helps others discover the magic of CRO Pulse.

Give your forms the boost they deserve with CRO Pulse! 🚀

🏗️ Update log 🏗️ 
v1.1.5: CRO Pulse Analytics were added.

v1.1.4: We fixed the side panel so it no longer plays hide-and-seek—it now opens reliably. Screenshots and DEMO mode also work better together. Interaction time was disguised as not a number, but now it displays appropriately in seconds. And finally, in DEMO mode, we now highlight fields that can't be analysed because they lack a name or ID.

v1.1.3: Initial release
